So, I've heard tons and tons of XXXX dissing them so so much, but I would honestly like some opinions of people who DO think they benefit and if you think that, mind providing some evidence? I really just want to see the other side to the story.

post_info.post_title: Do big box retailers benefit the local communities they reside in.

Depends on one's point of view. If entering the job market, the US military offers better pay. For those citizens experiencing stagnant wages and inflation, they offer lower prices due to volume. At a community level, they make tax contributions equivalent to the same sales volume of those smaller businesses they eliminate but do remove profits from the immediate community. For entrepreneurs, specialty stores offering a step up do well in big box shopping proximity. From an environmental viewpoint, they're concentrated users of resources dictated by technology in construction and efficiency rather than dated, inefficient systems in older establishments.
